intro: Capanemia spathuliglossa, commonly known as the broad-lipped capanemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically display a range of colors from white to pale blue. The plant has oval, hairy leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. Native to certain regions of South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
